Node.gloss: to go up|to climb up|to mount
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals or objects go to a place that is situated at a higher elevation, by foot, carried by hand, or with the help of a vehicle
= a human or supernatural being who carries a message on behalf of someone else
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= location; ◄ close to Jericho (יְרִחֹו) ► first camp of Israelites (יִשְׂרָאֵל) after crossing the Jordan (יַרְדֵּן) here they set up twelve stones as a monument; it later became the location of a cultic center
= location ► where the Angel of YHWH appeared to the Israelites (יִשְׂרָאֵל) after the conquest of the promised land

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or objects to go to a place that is situated at a higher elevation, by foot or carried by hand, or with the help of a vehicle

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= action by which humans or deities make a solemn statement often calling on a higher power to confirm that what is said is true or to punish the speaker if it turns out not to be true
= indirect male progenitor

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= referent to a group of male (and female) participants that are addressed if a discourse

Node.gloss: to make a covenant|to make a treaty
Node.definition: literally: to cut (a covenant); hence: = action by which two or more parties make a solemn agreement, accompanied by stipulations, blessings, and curses
= a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= construction with a flat top, ◄ originally made out of stones that were not cut and shaped with tools, later also out of metal; ► used for burning sacrifices

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= causative action by which people are expelled from their dwelling place

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= side of a person's body, especially of the rump, right above the hip; ► place where people sometimes carried their small children; ≈ location where one's body is unprotected and vulnerable
plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= contraption; ► used for catching animals; ≈ associated with aggression and control

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= a human or supernatural being who carries a message on behalf of someone else
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
literally: to lift up (one's) voice = action by which humans speak with a loud voice

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

Node.gloss: to cry|to weep|to lament|to mourn|to bewail
Node.definition: = action by which someone express his/her grief or sorrow by shedding tears, crying loud and making appropriate gestures, ◄ because of some personal or national calamity, or for a dead person
literally: to cry out (someone's) name (something); hence: = action by which humans assign a name to a person or place
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= location ► where the Angel of YHWH appeared to the Israelites (יִשְׂרָאֵל) after the conquest of the promised land

= the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to let go|to dismiss|to send (someone) on his way|to free|to release
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities allow (other) humans to leave a certain place and go home

= man, also known as Hoshea (הֹושֵׁעַ) and Jeshua (יֵשׁוּעַ) ◄ son of Nun (נוּן) tribe of Ephraim (אֶפְרַיִם) ► one of the twelve men sent by Moses (מֹשֶׁה) to spy out the land; his name was Hoshea, later changed by Moses to Joshua (יְהֹושֻׁעַ) Moses' assistant, who later became his successor and brought Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) into Canaan (כְּנַעַן)

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= action by which humans, either as individuals or as groups, assume a position of subservience towards a deity, perform the required rituals, and live in accordance with the requirements of that deity

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time

= a council or a group of older men who act with authority on behalf of or over their people; some represent an entire nation, others manage the affairs at the town level; some provide their leader with counsel; involved in both judicial and military decisions, and participating in cultic ceremonies; ≈ expected to be wise and considered worthy of deference and respect
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= a cardinal direction indicating the direction to the left of a person when facing the direction of the rising sun‎, ◄ named after Mount Zaphon which is located in northern Syria

= mountainous region, ◄ located in the territory of Ephraim (אֶפְרַיִם)

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= indirect male progenitor
= marker pointing out that the information that follows represents the logical consequence of what has been stated before
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= process by which an action is repeated or continued
= causative action by which humans or deities take over the ownership of land from other humans, which usually implies that the former owners are driven away

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place

= man, also known as Hoshea (הֹושֵׁעַ) and Jeshua (יֵשׁוּעַ) ◄ son of Nun (נוּן) tribe of Ephraim (אֶפְרַיִם) ► one of the twelve men sent by Moses (מֹשֶׁה) to spy out the land; his name was Hoshea, later changed by Moses to Joshua (יְהֹושֻׁעַ) Moses' assistant, who later became his successor and brought Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) into Canaan (כְּנַעַן)
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

Node.gloss: to test|to put to the test
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities make an effort to obtain information about (other) humans by observing them while they engage in a certain activity

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= action by which humans or deities act in accordance with a certain (usually) prescribed pattern of behavior, such as a law, covenant, etc.

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes
= action by which humans or deities act in accordance with a certain (usually) prescribed pattern of behavior, such as a law, covenant, etc.
= indirect male progenitor

= particle linking two events and denoting that X takes places in order to establish whether Y is true or not; X is often elided, which turns the remainder of the phrase into a question, which is often rhetorical
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers
= particle marking a proposition as not true
= causative action by which humans or deities take over the ownership of land from other humans, which usually implies that the former owners are driven away
= action by which humans or deities act without delay
literally: hand; hence: = state of being in a position of control and authority over objects or people

= man, also known as Hoshea (הֹושֵׁעַ) and Jeshua (יֵשׁוּעַ) ◄ son of Nun (נוּן) tribe of Ephraim (אֶפְרַיִם) ► one of the twelve men sent by Moses (מֹשֶׁה) to spy out the land; his name was Hoshea, later changed by Moses to Joshua (יְהֹושֻׁעַ) Moses' assistant, who later became his successor and brought Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) into Canaan (כְּנַעַן)
